website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Racer ST 5 offers excellent arch support and underfoot cradling. It is a very versatile stability running shoe that can easily transform from a race day shoe into a rugged daily trainer that can do both distance and speed training. This shoe is praised by many because it is affordable and reliable.
pros: A few testers coveted the Racer ST 5’s ability to tackle the long distance runs, as well as speed trainings
Several runners took notice of how responsive this model was when it came to their performance
The low profile nature of the forefoot gives the shoe superb ground feedback
The traction of the Brooks Racer ST 5 is more than adequate on the road based on the reviews of a handful of runners
The Diagonal Rollbar Technology allows mild over-pronators to enjoy this running shoe without adding weight
It has an average weight that’s agreeable to the preferences of most runners
cons: Most of the reviewers were frustrated by the quality of the laces, which tended to easily become unraveled
A gender-specific fit is something a large majority of runners would have wanted from the Racer ST 5
The 12mm heel differential, especially for a racer, did not sit well for forefoot and mid-foot strikers

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe if you like minimalist trainers but need a bit more support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe lasts so long. I have never had a shoe wear so well. Years of races and marathons and it is still great! It is also light and wide enough in the toe box so I don't lose toe nails. The only thing I don't like is the shoelaces kept coming untied, so I replaced them. I highly recommend this shoe for anyone looking for something just a notch more cushion than a racing flat, and whatever they use to make this foam, it sure lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Tenderg Host

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for racer 3
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a racer 3 for my runs. It was a great shoe until it was time to replace it. The racer ST 5 is an excellent replacement which feels modern and safe. So far a nice companion for my training for PF Changs Marathon in Phoenix in January. I have great expectations and hope I can achieve my best time ever.
customer_reviews.author: Felaya

customer_reviews.title: My favorite running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this shoe and I have run in the Racer ST since the ST 3 in 2009. I have slight pronation that has gotten less severe with age and this shoe is enough support, it is firmer than other shoes but I like feeling the road and not like I am running on clouds. My last pair met their match at a TM. I can usually get 350 miles out of these, 175 lbs 6'2"
customer_reviews.author: A. Fengler

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good quality running show. I used this pair for a couple years before I replaced them. Great for long distance running (treadmill or cross country)
customer_reviews.author: Kingfish

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is absolutely amazing, super light, duration, like running on a cloud. I do run alot mainly in competition and I am currently using a pair of Ascics for training and these for race day and the combination is working well. I wouldn't train long term with these shoes as they offer less support that a runner or x-trainer but trade that for speed. Although I am quite disappointed with the delivery time taking almost 1 month to receive considering the expected time was 1 week...
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe, but the shoe laces are cheap. Had to spend a few extra bucks to get decent laces and also an athletic sole.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Racer ====ST==cant wait 4 racing season.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright-exact size fit, cool mesh, hoping to allow more training runs. Looking also forward to track sessions and public running again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  C>>Burnside

customer_reviews.title: good looking shoes but...
customer_reviews.text: There a good looking shoe but that's all they are at this point because I can not wear them, I take a size 8.5 wide so as per others comments who said they fit correctly I ordered them. well I can not wear them they are way to big, and my feet slide backwards and forwards inside the shoe while jogging which caused terrible blisters, so there they sit worn 2 times .... now I'm back to my old running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: I bought a pair before, so i kind of know what I want.
customer_reviews.text: this pair is more like a natural running shoes. no extra support, but more like to push you feel the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable and are great for long days when I know I will be walking a lot. I usually wear a size 12, however, I had to return the 12's for a 12.5 size and they fit perfectly. I wear mostly Nike, however, these are some of my favorite shoes among my 25+ pairs of running shoes. I also like them because of the color and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe! It is light for long distance training and it is wide enough to fit my awkward feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kipchirchir Bitok

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Light, comfortable, good transition from the Brooks GTS. I would remain under 10 miles per unless you've truly prepared yourself in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: sizing stated that they were true to size but were not, almost a size too big.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A great sneaker
customer_reviews.text: What I love about Brooks running shoes is that they are designed to support a pronated arch. I also love the flexibility of the shoe, the spring that they lend to your step. And finally, let me report a remark made about the color of the shoe: a friend at the gym raised his eyebrows at the eyecatching color and exclaimed, "Ah! A hunting sneaker!"
customer_reviews.author: Affineur

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pair of shoes for my teenager. He has worn them everyday to school this year. They are a great quality product. He loves any product in his school colors, so that was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes! But I need a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Alston

customer_reviews.title: Size runs large
customer_reviews.text: I always were brooks. They are my ultimate favorite. This pair although comfy is very large for me. I have large feet (woman 11). Never run into a size 11 that was big. Should have returned them, but I havent
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Castillo

customer_reviews.title: A great Support race shoe
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Brooks and told them that I was racing and training in their Transend line of shoes. THey are great shoes but a wee bit heavy (my size 14, 9oz per shoe) I asked them about a race shoe, they suggested this shoe. It weighs in at 5oz a shoe (size 14). I raced 2 five k's in them and they work fantastic. Totally happy I bought them as race shoes. Bill
customer_reviews.author: happy bill

customer_reviews.title: Fast Marathon Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for those who have completed a marathon or two, and want to step up their game. Not quite a racing flat, these feel fast but still offer great support over the longer distances. You'll see a bunch of people in the elite corrals wearing these shoes. Yes, the laces are pretty bad. I just used the extra laces from my Ravennas. Problem solved. Still 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: My first Brooks. I used it for my first 70.3. Very comfortable. Great support. Great for training or racing. I don't like the laces , so I changed it for Lock Laces. Great for 21K or 42K. I will buy another pair of shoes for my next 70.3 or 42K. Recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Ralfo

customer_reviews.title: Bold, light and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes! Just purchased these for the upcoming LA Marathon where I am chasing a Boston Qualifier. Started running in them for the last 2 weeks training and I am extremely excited for the race. The shoes are a great fit (make sure you buy a half size up though as usual),extremely light but also provide got cushioning for distance. Delivery was excellent, free shipping arrived in 5 days including the weekend. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cook

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I' recommend it to anyone! Amazon's service was excellent, while Brooks' product feel awesome. The best for all runners!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Santiago Perdomo Santana

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I wish they still made them as I would have bought 5 pairs for future use.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Racer
customer_reviews.text: Delighted with these running shoes. Comfortable over distances run so far (up to 6 miles). Light yet robust and I love their 'stand-out' appearance. Great value - so much so I'm thinking of buying a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Bob King

product_meta.title: Brooks Racer ST 5 Racing Shoes
product_meta.description: The RACER ST5 is the ideal competition shoe for marathon distances. For the update, all successful comforts were of course kept, but the shoe is now fitted with BioMoGO. The upper is more aggressive. This model has a light support in the metatarsus region, but is flexible in the forefoot and extremely comfortable in the upper heel area.
feature_bullets: Rearfoot Hydroflow ST for great cushioning
